articles.author: Reuters
articles.title: Genome data sheds light on how Homo sapiens arose in Africa - The Indian Express
articles.description: The research indicated that multiple ancestral groups from across Africa contributed to the emergence of Homo sapiens in a patchwork manner, migrating from one region to another and mixing with one another over hundreds of thousands of years.
articles.content: Our species arose in Africa more than 300,000 years ago, with the oldest-known Homo sapiens fossils discovered at a site in Morocco called Jebel Irhoud, located between Marrakech and the Atlantic coa… [+3634 chars]

articles.title: Human-evolution story rewritten by fresh data and more computing power - Nature.com
articles.description: Humans did not emerge from a single region of Africa, suggests a powerful modelling study. Rather, our ancestors moved and intermingled for millennia.

articles.title: New DNA Research Changes Origin of Human Species - SciTechDaily
articles.description: New model for human evolution suggests Homo sapiens arose from multiple closely related populations. A new study in Nature challenges prevailing theories, suggesting that Homo sapiens evolved from multiple diverse populations across Africa, with the earliest …
articles.content:
